title: List of presidents of the United States who died in office
summary: Since the office was established in 1789, 45 persons have served as President of the United States.[lower-alpha 1] Of these, eight have died in office:[1] four were assassinated, and four died of natural causes. In each of these instances, the vice president has succeeded to the presidency. This practice is presently governed by Section One of the Twenty-fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution, ratified in 1967, which declares that, "the Vice President shall become President" if the president is removed from office, dies, or resigns.[2] The initial authorization for this practice was provided by Article II, Section 1, Clause 6 of the Constitution, as originally adopted, which stated:
